title: How to Bypass Anti‐AdBlockers in Chrome

steps.title: Go to the website.
steps.content: Go to the website. Go to any website which contains anti-adblockers using the Google Chrome browser.

steps.title: Open "Site Information".
steps.content: Open "Site Information". Just click the left side of the URL to open it.

steps.title: Locate JavaScript in the pop-up menu.
steps.content: Locate JavaScript in the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Done.
steps.content: Done. Reload the page to see the effects.

steps.title: Install a user script manager extension.
steps.content: Install a user script manager extension. Go to the Chrome Webstore and download an extension like Tampermonkey.

steps.title: Install a script to block ad-blockers.
steps.content: Install a script to block ad-blockers.

steps.title: Subscribe to the filter list for the specific adblocker you are using on your browser.
steps.content: Subscribe to the filter list for the specific adblocker you are using on your browser. To subscribe, visit GitHub . For uBlock Origin, you must enable AakList in Options > 3rd-party-filters and click 'Apply changes'. Supported browsers include Firefox, Chrome, Opera, Safari and Microsoft Edge. Supported adblockers include Adblock, Adblock Plus, uBlock Origin and Adguard AdBlocker.

steps.title: Re-launch your browser.
steps.content: Re-launch your browser. Re-launch the browser for the changes to take effect. The script will automatically detect the websites that are trying to block your ad-blocker and will bypass them easily.

steps.title: This is a method that works only for the one page you wish to see.
steps.content: This is a method that works only for the one page you wish to see. It will work until the page is reloaded or you exit. This method is perfect if disabling JavaScript did not work, or if you do not want to install third-party software.

steps.title: Right-click anywhere on the blocked page.
steps.content: Right-click anywhere on the blocked page. In the drop-down menu, select 'Inspect'.

steps.title: Find the HTML <div element(s) that blocks the page.
steps.content: Find the HTML <div element(s) that blocks the page. You may do this by hovering your cursor over <div each element, and when the right element is highlighted on the webpage, you have found it. Right-click on it and select 'Hide element' or 'Delete element'. You should now be able to see and use the webpage unhindered. If you made a mistake and deleted something that did not create the anticipated effect, just reload the page and start again. If the element was removed, but you cannot scroll the webpage, see the next step.

steps.title: Enable scrolling (if necessary).
steps.content: Enable scrolling (if necessary). To enable the scrolling on a webpage that disables it with an anti-AdBlocker, find the HTML element containing "Overflow : hidden" at the top of the list. You may need to click on the downward arrow next to the <body> tag. Then, replace "hidden" by "scroll".

steps.title: Can't find the "overflow"?
steps.content: Can't find the "overflow"? If you cannot find the "Overflow" element, try to find something that contains "scrolling:off" or "no-scroll" somewhere at the top of the script and replace it with something the positive alternative.
